ruleCategoryGroups.name: Data Quality Rules
ruleCategoryGroups.description: Covers rules that check data integrity, accuracy, completeness, and validity to ensure high-quality input for downstream processing.

ruleCategoryGroups.name: Business Logic Rules
ruleCategoryGroups.description: Defines rules that enforce domain-specific business operations, policies, and decision logic.

ruleCategoryGroups.name: Analytics Rules
ruleCategoryGroups.description: Includes rules that support reporting, KPIs, trend analysis, and other analytical processing needs.

ruleCategoryGroups.name: Audit & Logging Rules
ruleCategoryGroups.description: Ensures traceability and accountability by enforcing logging, monitoring, and audit trail requirements.

ruleCategoryGroups.name: Referential Integrity Rules
ruleCategoryGroups.description: Ensures that references between datasets remain consistent and valid.

ruleCategories.name: Validation
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that ensure records meet required data constraints, such as date formats, non-null fields, or valid numerical ranges.

ruleCategories.name: Transformation
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that standardize, map, or convert raw input data into a canonical or expected format.

ruleCategories.name: Aggregation
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that summarize or aggregate data across multiple records, typically for analytics or reporting purposes.

ruleCategories.name: Audit
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that ensure auditability, such as logging of invalid records or tracking unhandled exceptions.

ruleCategories.name: Uniqueness
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that check that a record is unique i.e. there are no duplicates.

ruleCategories.name: Filtering
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that restrict, select, or exclude records based on specific criteria.

ruleCategories.name: Integrity
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that ensure consistency, validity, and logical correctness of datasets.

ruleCategories.name: Cleanup
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that remove invalid, redundant, or obsolete data to maintain dataset hygiene.

ruleCategories.name: Referential Integrity
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: Rules that ensure foreign keys and cross-table references remain consistent.

ruleCategories.name: User Interface
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: A rule that exists purely to affect the user interface behavior.

ruleCategories.name: Workflow
ruleCategories.categorizationGuidance: A rule that exists purely to affect the path that a workflow takes.
